TopicTitle: [0.20] Kerbal LiveFeed: Passive Multiplayer Plugin/Client/Server v0.6.6

Articles.Content: I hope somebody can help me i did read the readme but i dont understand where i need to place the KLFclient and KLFserver.exe, i did already place this on the mod support page but nobody did help me and i think that more people read this section of the forum.
You place it directly in the KSP _ win folder. If you use steam I got no idea.
Are you just trying to run it as a plugin or do you want to have your own server?
I dont need a own server just normal
Put the .dll into the plugins folder, the antenna part into your parts folder, and the client .exe into your ksp folder. Run the EXE, follow directions, connect, open ksp, F7 hides/shows the panel
Well it isnt that easy, because i have a mac, and i dont know what to type in terminal, and i did already instal mono.

AH! As am I, I'll be home soon, I can help you then. I wrote a little quick-launch button for mac, because the commands are simple but tedious to type every time, that I can give you.

I assume you already moved everything into place?

AH! As am I, I'll be home soon, I can help you then. I wrote a little quick-launch button for mac, because the commands are simple but tedious to type every time, that I can give you.

I assume you already moved everything into place?

Hi yes i think that i did place everything on the right place the plugin at least, im not sure about the parts folder, havent seen them in game yet. And i did place the .exe file in the map where all the other things are standing like gamedata, savefiles, ships etc etc.

I hope that you can help me,

Greetings me.

Sorry, my power went out yesterday so I couldn't send you that...

The part never actually shows up in game but its necessary I think. Anyways, if you download, unzip and put this file in the same place the .exe is and double click it, it should open the client just like it works on windows, you can then do your settings and connect. You can open the file in TextEdit or something and see what it does precisely. All it really does is navigate to the right place and then open the .exe with mono, but it's quick and effortless so why not.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/99458555/StartKLF.command.zip
Hi thank you i think that it works now i only need to find a server and take a look at it.
Theres a couple servers on the forum topic for KLF.
